data.title: good quality of food and service, good for business meals.
data.text: come here often for business lunch with customers for years. This place offers great services, consistently good quality of food over the years, and great location with easy parking (there's a parking garage near by - free of charge). This place is also ideal for a nice dinner for special occasions but will require reservation ahead of time.

data.title: Great food and drinks
data.text: The service was great and Lemon drop martinis I would highly recommend.  The service was great best food in Round Rock!

data.title: Nice couples night out
data.text: Linen tablecloths, music provided by violin & guitar (was a test program on the Thursday we dined), quiet so you could converse--features you don't find at many restaurants.  Enjoyed avocado crisp appetizer (different and tasty).  Special of the day was lobster which was well prepared.  Also had flounder which was over-covered in their spicy shrimp/scallop sauce.  Have the sauce on the side, it overpowered the fish dramatically.  The menu offered a nice variety of items for your choice.  Their Caesar salad dressing had an unexpected spice in it which did not appeal to our palate.  Had a great double chocolate desert.  They like to provide a desert which you can pour a shot of liquor over.  An enjoyable night out.

data.title: Great date night destination
data.text: Main Street Grill is a nice, quaint restaurant.  The food is excellent and the service is great.  It's quiet enough to enjoy good conversation.  I perfect night out.

data.title: Donut Bread Pudding
data.text: Awesome food, great service.  Get the room in the safe if having a couple's date.  Nice, quaint and out of the way.  Round Rock donuts are awesome by themselves.  I am not a fan of bread pudding.  Have tried many different restaurants and people's attempts. However, put a Round Rock donut in the bread pudding, it becomes heavenly.

data.title: A new Favorite restaurant
data.text: My wife and I went to the Main Street Grill for a nice pleasant dinner.   The menu had a diverse listing of choices and all sounded great.   We had Coconut shirmp for an appetizer, shared a Monica's salad and then for entrees had the Downtown Duo (Steak and shrimp) and the Southwestern Pork Tenderloin.   Everything was fresh, prepared perfectly and tasted great.   The portions were just right as well versus being too large you can't finish.  The wine selection was very good with a wide price range.   Service was excellent and they even had live music at just the right level to enjoy but still have a conversation.   When we finished and left we said this is now one of our top favorite restaurants in the Round Rock, Georgetown area.  The only downside to this restaurant and almost all others in Round Rock is the rest room can only accommodate one person at a time.  This should really be improved.   Lastly the atmosphere was very cool for relaxing, talking and enjoying everything without the service staff rushing you.

data.title: Okay if you like strong fish. Skip the steak or tell them to hold the gravy and put your shrimp on the side
data.text:
I was really looking forward to a good steak while visiting TX but my meal was a huge disappointment. I ordered the steak and shrimp "any way you want" and ended up with a fishy tasting meal and the blandest steak and 'blackened' shrimp ever.  Everything on my plate tasted like fish had been put on the plate before they decided they needed the plate for my meal. They did get the fresh green beans right - nice and crisp- but ruined the dish with odd food prep practices. Even the mashed potatoes with blue cheese mixed in tasted fishy. What's worse, a disgusting brown sauce (which wasn't even on the dish description) was dumped on the plate and ran into the meat and potatoes. When I order a $30 steak, I expect to be able to taste it and that it would be savory enough to not need hiding with some kind of sauce.

We were a party of 8 and made a reservation for an early dinner so the place was not at all crowded, then (6:30 on a Sat.) or at any point through the meal. Hostess was great and returned my message to confirm, but didn't think that we might actually want to have a conversation over dinner. We were placed next to the live musicians who were just too loud for such a small restaurant. It would have been a big production to move everyone so we tried to make the best of it. Even though the waitress asked them to turn it down some, they kept getting loud (they were supposed to be background Christmas music, no vocals).

Others in our party ordered the grilled salmon or salads. They seemed happy with their meals. The key lime pie dessert was a bad deal - it looked like the kitchen staff kept back a half a piece for themselves. The Round Rock doughnut bread pudding was a hit for those who tried it. The brie appetizer cheese dip was also tasty, but I can't eat wheat so can't comment about the bread. The glass of wine was a decent pour amount for the cost.

Overall, the place wins for ambience, being wheelchair accessible, and for location - downtown Round Rock is so quaint these days.  They did an okay job with the salads and fish dishes, but coming from Atlanta, I have to say, this is overpriced, and the kitchen needs to work on a few things. It was also surprising to see there were no gluten-free options at a restaurant in this price range.

data.title: A real surprise!
data.text:
Stopped in here - the first time - because the Italian restaurant up the street was closed on a Monday night.

I'm sure I've had better meals - but I'm not sure I've been more delighted by one. We came back two days later; my colleague wanted to try the cod that I'd raved over, and I got to try the roast pork. It's been a long time since I've scraped every bit of sauce off a plate...but I was defending my plate from the server as I got every speck of the delicious sauce.

And yes, the pork was amazingly tender - and more, it tasted like pork, not just bland pale meat.

The cod was perfectly crisp, yet almost liquid in the center.

Yeah - upgraded from four to five stars as I think back on the meals. 

Oh - save room for dessert. You'll thank yourself.

Staff couldn't have been friendlier or more professional.

...a keeper.

data.title: Has seen better days.....
data.text: Took a client there for a special thank you early dinner. Sat in the vault room. There was such a strong smell of mold and the view was the attendants station. Cheap bottles of wine along with the very old lighting was no bueno. The food was excellent as was the service but we did have folks come in to the wine room to get bottles while we were eating. It's not like a real wine room with bottles ceiling to floor that really need to be locked up. It was more like an old crawl space with a rack bought at target and placed on the back wall. I am super allergic to mold and by the time we were done with our apps I couldn't breathe. Pricey but definitely not a good place to take a client.

data.title: And Old Bank Serving Up Excellent Meals
data.text: We visited this small restaurant with some friends on a Monday night.  It wasn't very crowded, so it wasn't so noisy that we couldn't talk.  It's a cute little place located in downtown Round Rock and a bank used to operate there.  In fact, they still use the old bank vault for romantic dinner for a couple.  They have a fine selection of wines and the pinot noir we ordered was excellent. The salads (ala carte) were fresh and had blue cheese chucks, strawberries with mixed greens and vinaigrette served on the side. The ladies both ordered the same combo of steak and shrimp that were cooked to perfection.  I ordered the mesquite smoked duck (HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT) and the other gentleman ordered the halibut special.  All of the meals were superb along with the service we received.  It's very pricey so it's not a place most people will frequent on a regular basis.  But it is one of the better restaurants in this part of the Austin suburbs.

data.title: Special occasion spot
data.text: Great for a special occasion. I say special, because it is pricey, but the nice ambiance, good service, delicious food, make it a great anniversary date venue.

data.title: The best in Round Rock
data.text: Fantastic , properly prepared meals. Seafood excellent, perfect pasta. Expensive but worth it. We have dined there 3 times to date, it still is the best.

data.title: Real Silverware!
data.text: Nicest place to dine in Round Rock. Great food and the whitest crispest table linen reflects the care that they have for their guest

data.title: What I'd like to have is a good rating to issue
data.text: This is not average but not very good. It rocks back and forth between really, really wonderful-especially the tuna with wasabai sauce and only very average. I've been in 3 times in a row now and its always a mystery why it varies so much. Its worth a shot if you're already in downtown RR.

data.title: Maybe overpriced.. but very good.
data.text: Limited menu but everything we've had tasted great. Nice environment. Upscale for Round Rock which is much needed

data.title: The place in Round Rock for Lunch
data.text:
This is the 2nd time I have been to this restaurant. the first time I have reviewed it. I have to say they go out of their way to make you feel at home and comfortable in their restaurant. Our waiter was very good, polite and professional. 
We actually ate in the walk-in safe. Very quiet and you can conduct your business without being bothered by outside noise. 
I had Monica's Salad, which was great and a bowl of the Tomato Bisque. Wow, it was outstanding. 
Prices are reasonable, the food is great and their customer service is outstanding. 
I highly recommend this restaurant if you are in the Round Rock, TX area.

data.title: Doesn't disappoint.
data.text: We have eaten here a few times over the past few years. Wonderful, tender steak with sides included for the price. Good service, nice atmosphere, especially for couples and adults. Consistent.

data.title: When we want a special evening or to celebrate an event with a great dining experience this is our go to in Round Rock.
data.text:
As usual Main Street Grill in Round Rock proved it's reputation as the place to go for a very nice food, wine, and cocktails experience in Round Rock.  The Monica's salad is a must order menu item.  Our party had 4 different items spanning the usual menu and the evening's special selections.  All were excellent.

The service was  up to the high standard of the food.

Definitely the place to go for a nice evening of dining in Round Rock.

data.title: Fine dinning Little town
data.text: The food here is truly crafted for a more upscale palate. Nice to see locals learn that great food is being served. Lunch and Dinner are always offering different items to try. Worth the trip, worth the money

data.title: Very Good Meal
data.text: This is the second time dining at Main Street Grill when traveling from the Finger Lakes in New York State. The crab cake appetizer was absolutely outstanding - best crab cake I can remember. My dinner was good - that it was not outstanding may be a function of what I ordered and not the cooking (Gnocchi with a heavy cream sauce - not something I usually order). My dining companions all were more enthralled than I with their meals. The atmosphere is nice and quiet and it was perfect for chatting with the relative we came to visit. When we spilled our wine, we realized that exactly the same thing happened the last time we dined here - and it occurred to us that it is because the tables were not even (two tables together with about an inch difference in height). If they can fix that, it might save a few tablecloths. All in all, it was a very good meal.
